Description: Green glazed steatite amulet in the form of a naos; the sides are decorated with open-work representations of a leonine goddess and a uraeus wearing the solar-disc and the back bears a similar representation of a winged scarab; a two-leaf door opens at the front to reveal an inner shrine containing the aegis of a leonine goddess; at the top is a uraeiform cornice with a suspension ring behind.
Curator's comments: Published: Andrews, Amulets of Ancient Egypt (1994): p.15
Acquisition name: Donated by: Egypt Exploration Society (Committee of)
In Memory of: Gen Sir John Grenfell Maxwell
